message.content:
I'll calculate the (Increase) Decrease in Inventory for the cash flow statement by analyzing the purchase and sale transactions of inventory items.

First, I need to identify which transactions affect inventory:
1. Purchases of products (type "Purchase") increase inventory
2. Sales of products (type "Sale") decrease inventory

Step 1: Summarize all the purchases that increase inventory.
```
Purchase20231231001: 1,000,000.00 (Heavy Equipment C)
Purchase20231231002: 1,000,000.00 (Heavy Equipment C)
Purchase20231231003: 1,000,000.00 (Heavy Equipment C)
Purchase20231231004: 1,500,000.00 (Heavy Equipment D)
Purchase20231231005: 3,000,000.00 (Heavy Equipment D)
Purchase20231231006: 1,600,000.00 (Heavy Equipment B)
Purchase20231231007: 800,000.00 (Heavy Equipment B)
Purchase20231231008: 1,000,000.00 (Heavy Equipment A)
Purchase20231231009: 1,600,000.00 (Heavy Equipment B)
Purchase20231231010: 1,500,000.00 (Heavy Equipment D)
Purchase20231231011: 500,000.00 (Heavy Equipment A)
Purchase20231231012: 1,600,000.00 (Heavy Equipment B)
Purchase20231231013: 500,000.00 (Heavy Equipment A)
Purchase20231231014: 1,500,000.00 (Heavy Equipment D)
Purchase20231231015: 3,000,000.00 (Heavy Equipment D)
Purchase20231231016: 2,000,000.00 (Heavy Equipment C)
Purchase20231231017: 1,500,000.00 (Heavy Equipment D)
Purchase20231231018: 3,000,000.00 (Heavy Equipment D)
```

Total purchases: 27,600,000.00

Step 2: Calculate inventory reduction from sales.
For each sale, I need to use the cost_amount which represents the inventory cost of the sold items.

```
Sale20240103001: 1,000,000.00 (Heavy Equipment C)
Sale20240106004: 800,000.00 (Heavy Equipment B)
Sale20240107006: 1,500,000.00 (Heavy Equipment D)
Sale20240109007: 800,000.00 (Heavy Equipment B)
Sale20240110009: 800,000.00 (Heavy Equipment B)
Sale20240113011: 1,500,000.00 (Heavy Equipment D)
Sale20240117016: 500,000.00 (Heavy Equipment A)
Sale20240118017: 800,000.00 (Heavy Equipment B)
Sale20240119019: 1,500,000.00 (Heavy Equipment D)
Sale20240120020: 500,000.00 (Heavy Equipment A)
Sale20240121022: 1,500,000.00 (Heavy Equipment D)
Sale20240124024: 1,000,000.00 (Heavy Equipment C)
Sale20240127028: 1,000,000.00 (Heavy Equipment C)
Sale20240128030: 1,500,000.00 (Heavy Equipment D)
Sale20240130032: 1,500,000.00 (Heavy Equipment D)
Sale20240201034: 1,500,000.00 (Heavy Equipment D)
Sale20240203036: 1,500,000.00 (Heavy Equipment D)
Sale20240204039: 1,000,000.00 (Heavy Equipment C)
```

Total sales (at cost): 20,200,000.00

Step 3: Calculate the (Increase) Decrease in Inventory

Inventory increase (purchases): 27,600,000.00
Inventory decrease (sales at cost): 20,200,000.00

(Increase) Decrease in Inventory = Inventory decrease - Inventory increase
(Increase) Decrease in Inventory = 20,200,000.00 - 27,600,000.00 = -7,400,000.00

A negative value indicates a net increase in inventory during the period. For cash flow statement purposes, this is shown as a negative number since inventory increases represent cash outflows.

{"solution": {'(Increase) Decrease in Inventory': '-7400000.00'}}
